abstract.para: Description of a Medulla 2 image folder

section.title: Overall organization
section.para: A Medulla 2 image is contained in a folder, with files containing information, and files containing meta-information.

section.title: Files containing information
section.para: The file collection contains the image data.

section.title: CONF
section.para: The file reflects the image content. Syntax as follow :
section.screen: D:<disk-num> L:<disk-size> R <disk-letter><part-num> , S:<start block> , E:<end-block>, t:<part-size> ... E

section.title: [P-S]TABS
section.para: The is the exact copy of the first needed sectors. For example, 63 sectors for regular PC/Dos partition table.

section.title: [P-S][1-8][0-9]{3}
section.para: The is a chunk of the backuped image.

section.title: Files containing meta-information
section.para: Those files contain other-than-the-client-data information : logs, GRUB template ...

section.title: conf.txt
section.para: The is a Grub 1 config file chunk. More precisely, this contains a full grub 1 item :
section.screen: title <the image title> desc <the image description> <additionnal GRUB commands goes there>
section.para: Amongst GRUB commands (see the grub project for more details), Mandriva added a few commands to permit restoration using TFTP protocol :

listitem.para: PART: a partition, GrUB syntax ((hd0,0) for ex.)
PREFIX: The image prefix (P1 for example)
TYPE: The PC/DOS partition kind (83 for Linux for example)
DISK: a disk, GrUB syntax ((hd0) for ex.)
NAME: the name of the file containing the partition table (PTABS for example)

section.title: size.txt
section.para: This is the output of a simple 'du -k' done on the image folder after the backup operation.

section.title: size<maj><min>.txt
section.para: The is the size, in 512 B blocks, of the image with <maj> as major (hex), <min> as minor (hex).
